reviewText: This is the Costco version (with the extra disc) and I bought it there for $28.99. So, $64.90 seems like a rip off, IMO. This is a nice set to own. I have never seen these episodes before.

For those who have never seen these, be prepared.  Yes, it's funny.  Yes, it's well done.  But it's not up to the standard of later season, it's obvious they're "getting their feet wet".  You will enjoy it, just be ready for some "OMG" moments as you watch.

I always laugh at people who write a review !  I am about to place my order for the Carol Burnett  show lost episodes. I have the other ones I watch her every time they show the reruns on television and I cannot wait to get this Dvd. For years I have been looking for a particular episode in which Dick van Dyck, Carol Vicky and Harvey walking in to the screen and sit down and chairs dressed in concert black to play little chamber music on their toes.  On their big toes. It was hilarious. I pray it's in these lost years.

I have greatly enjoyed the 2012 "Ultimate Carol Burnett," which - thankfully - turned out to not be the final word on Carol's remarkable 11-year run on CBS.  Here in "The Carol Burnett Show: The Lost Episodes," we can now enjoy 16 uncut shows from 1967-1972.  None of these shows were part of the "Ultimate" package.  The great attraction here is revisiting the debut of many classic characters and sketches.  The list is extensive, but my favorites include: the twisted soap opera "As the Stomach Turns;" The Old Folks, Carol and Sis, Harvey Korman as Mother Marcus, and anything with Tim Conway.  Conway was not an official member of the cast until 1975, but he appeared in many early shows.  He often steals the sketch.
"The Lost Episodes" also features a Hollywood all-star list of guests: Bob Newhart, Lucille Ball (Carol's comedy hero), Don Rickles, Bing Crosby, Andy Griffith, Burt Reynolds, and many more.  My personal favorites are Don Adams and the great - somewhat forgotten - Paul Lynde.  Both men are a riot in their respective appearances.
The musical numbers are often dated, but saved by the "groovy" period costumes and dancers.  Bonus features spread across the 6 discs include recent interviews with cast members and guests (and a backstage tour led by Carol herself).  Also appearing in bonus clips are current comedy stars (Bill Hader, Queen Latifah) who discuss the impact Carol Burnett has had on their careers and comedy on television.  Bonus sketches from other shows are also included at the end of most discs.
The verdict: hours of great viewing from the golden age of television comedy.  Carol Burnett was - and is - a giant of comedy.  I'm hoping there are more Carol Burnett Shows in the vault ready for release.

I have the other Carol Burnett DVDs and just saw that the first 5 years of her show have never been released!  So excited about this because new shows will be so much fun! UPDATE!!! This was my first DVD set I bought, as I was planning on buying the Lost Episode sets one by one. The bonus disc is actually disc #13 from the "Classic Carol" set which, after opening it, I was very upset about. Nowhere does it say that if you are planing on buying the individual sets, there's no reason to buy this one. I lowered the product by one star just because of this. Basically, my 6-DVD set of "Classic Carol" sadly turned in to a 5-DVD set :(

Of course it's great to see the first five seasons for the first time! And of course the extras are lots of fun too. My one main criticism is that the episodes are not in chronological order. Even though it would be ideal, I know that it would be very costly to release each season one by one due to music licencing. However, I would have preferred that the first disc start with the very first episode (which is on disc 2) so that we can see the evolution and progression of the show from day one. I think that most of the fans would have preferred it that way too!
DISAPPOINTING  AT BEST.

Carol Burnett never fails to entertain and her and her crew always manages to get laughs no matter what. This collection is well worth getting, providing hours of TV you won't see on cable no matter how many channels the "Extra Ultra Prime Package" has. I like the comedy featured on the channel but I also really enjoyed the variety of musical acts. While many of them weren't exactly what I normally look for, it is refreshing to see some different versions of songs and a well-done musical number, as opposed to today's music programs which all look and sound the same.

Greeting Reviewer,
When I was younger, I enjoyed watching and experiencing the humor on The Carol Burnett Show.  So when the DVD version came out I purchased three of the season sets.  I must have viewed the program with more innocent eyes back then. When I started viewing the recorded DVD season series, I did not realize how much "Adult" content (PG-13) was seen on TV back then.  I am not a prude, but I feel a level of responsibility to filter what my young children view and absorb. So I gave a rating for Adult content of 4-star rating (PG-13) for adults, but for the family I give it a rating of 3-stars as it definitely is not (PG) for children.

I can't say I didn't like it but it's not great either.  1) no captioning for the hearing impaired; 2) sound is iffy especially during the questions part at the beginning of the show (yes, there is a disclaimer in the DVD set), I think they could have done a better job or if they had problems with sound transfer then at least included captioning to help. 3) I can't remember now why I liked this show, a lot of it is slapstick, vaudeville, etc.  Some of the episodes/skits are fun but so far most are just too campy and "oh brother" type of stuff.
To be truthful I've only watched the first two discs and formed the above opinion, I can only hope the skits get better but I'm not holding my breath.  I would not buy this for myself nor anyone else even if they were fierce Carol Burnett Show fans.

Hysterical!!  After watching an ad for this on TV, tears of laughter were streaming down my cheeks and I had to have it.  The full set does not disappoint.  Not only is it really funny, it is a window into the not too distant past and much of the humor remains topical. In her own wacky way, Carol Burnett really pushed the cultural envelope.  The musical numbers can get corny but that too is a blast from the past. Highly recommended and an especially good gift idea for boomers.

The Carol Burnett Show: The Lost Episodes is a 6-DVD set containing 16 uncut episodes from Seasons 1 through 5 (1967-1972), selected by Carol Burnett herself. Though many collections of this show have been issued in the past, these programs are new to DVD and haven't been seen in over 40 years. The variety show originated in CBS Television Citys Studio 33 in Hollywood and ran from 1967 to 1978. It won 25 prime-time Emmy Awards and in 2007 was listed as one of Time magazines 100 Best TV Shows of All Time. Burnett has been honored with more Peoples Choice Awards than any other actress.

CBS wanted Burnett to do a sitcom, but she said she preferred a variety format where she could play different characters each week with a regular ensemble cast. She had achieved success in this format on The Garry Moore Show a few years earlier. Original regulars included Harvey Korman, Vicki Lawrence, and Lyle Waggoner. Frequent guest star Tim Conway would become a regular cast member in Season 8. Each weeks show was taped twice in front of different audiences and the best parts from each taping were edited together.

The set includes the sketches The Old Folks, Carol and Sis, Alice Portnoy, V.I.P., George and Zelda, Charwoman, and As the Stomach Turns. Guest stars featured include Don Adams, Lucille Ball, Bing Crosby, Phyllis Diller, Nanette Fabray, Andy Griffith, Steve Lawrence, Paul Lynde, Jim Nabors, Bob Newhart, Bernadette Peters, Burt Reynolds, Don Rickles, Mel Torme, Flip Wilson, and many others.

Included are over 5 hours of bonus features. They include a backstage tour of Carol and company returning to CBS Studio 33; never-before-seen bloopers and outtakes; the featurettes Fabulous Firsts and On the Spot: Carols Q & A; interviews with Julie Andrews, Carol Channing, Burt Reynolds, Alan Alda, Lesley Ann Warren, Don Rickles, and Carol Burnett herself; bonus sketches Morton at the Movies and The Dentist; and the opening number from the 1971 TV special Julie and Carol at Lincoln Center with a new introduction by Carol.

I hope and pray some day,. some way, some time all 278 original hour shows will be released as it will be a must for the home library of any Carol Burnett fan or lover of good quality TV.  This 6-disc set is a must-have.  Rare interviews, shows that haven't been seen in over 40 years, a tour of CBS Television City....worth every dime.
I am beginning to watch this and so far I am thoroughly entertained...I wish though they would put the episodes in order.

I'm SO excited about these episodes and can't wait for the DVDs.  I've been wearing out the last batch of Carol DVDs, and can't believe there are new episodes that have never been released.  Very cool that we can see the birth of this show and watch the characters evolve! A MUST HAVE!!!
